projectContext.name: zendesk-clickup-automation
projectContext.description: Multi-agent TypeScript automation system for Zendesk-ClickUp integration
projectContext.architecture: Multi-agent system with Cloudflare Workers deployment

sessions.task: Initialize Zendesk-ClickUp automation project development with multi-agent architecture and workflow orchestration capabilities

importantDecisions.projectArchitecture: Multi-agent TypeScript automation system with Cloudflare Workers deployment
importantDecisions.techStack: TypeScript, Cloudflare Workers, Multi-agent architecture with NLP routing
importantDecisions.codeOrganization: Modular structure with agents, services, config, types, and utils directories

globalDecisions.value: Multi-agent TypeScript automation system with Cloudflare Workers deployment
globalDecisions.reasoning: The project uses a sophisticated multi-agent architecture with separate agents for communication, orchestration, and planning. Built with TypeScript and configured for Cloudflare Workers deployment via Wrangler, enabling serverless execution of Zendesk-ClickUp automation workflows.

globalDecisions.value: TypeScript, Cloudflare Workers, Multi-agent architecture with NLP routing
globalDecisions.reasoning: Core technologies include TypeScript for type safety, Cloudflare Workers for serverless deployment, and a custom multi-agent system with NLP routing capabilities for intelligent task processing between Zendesk and ClickUp integrations.

globalDecisions.value: Modular structure with agents, services, config, types, and utils directories
globalDecisions.reasoning: The codebase is well-organized with clear separation of concerns: agents/ for multi-agent components, services/ for business logic including AI and integrations, config/ for project mappings and team assignments, types/ for TypeScript definitions, and utils/ for shared utilities. This structure supports maintainability and scalability.
